intro: Matelea mediocris, commonly known as the lesser matelea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink to purple in color, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in desert or semi-arid environments. Matelea mediocris is a perennial shrub that can grow up to 1 meter tall, with opposite, ovate leaves that are covered in fine hairs.
